result.execSummary:
The defendant Kameron J Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Pay all court costs.
Huber for work, treatment and child care.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: 14CF1363

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Concurrent with: 14CF1363

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with treatment program from mental health assessment including taking medications as prescribed. Participate in the Fatherhood Program. Comply with family court order. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Counseling that is directed towards domestic violence. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Huber for work, treatment and child care.
Consecutive to: count 1

16CF24

$500.00 CASH BOND PLUS $3,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  House arrest to 1133 Marquette St. with exceptions for ZCI Monitoring, court appearances, meetings with attorney and treatment program attendance. Defendant may attend AA meetings with proof of schedule filed prior to attendance and courts ok. Defendant must be in compliance with any conditions of the treatment program he enters into.    Defendant may only leave the house in the presence of his mother.     It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  Absolute sobriety required.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780). No contact with the victim, AM,  (person, property, residence or family).    Defendant must obtain a family court order regarding the child.    Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
2/27/15 - BOND AMENDED: GPS removed. No house arrest. Defendant must live at 1133 Marquette St. No violent contact w/A.M. - direct/indirect.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim, AM,  (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
